intro: Trithuria polybracteata, commonly known as the many-bract trithuria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Podostomaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and is typically found in freshwater habitats such as streams and rivers. The plant has a unique morphology, with its roots often submerged and its stems emerging from the water's surface. It is native to parts of Africa and is adapted to fast-flowing water environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized aquatic plant.
